title: Add backend integration guide to documentation
description:
**As a** developer evaluating Consoul for backend use
**I want** comprehensive documentation on backend integration patterns
**So that** I understand architecture, best practices, and security considerations

**Context:**
ChatGPT analysis emphasizes documentation as critical (lines 2257-2262). Current docs focus on CLI/TUI. Need dedicated backend integration guide covering:
- Architecture patterns (stateless HTTP vs stateful WebSocket)
- Session management strategies
- Security best practices
- Deployment considerations
- Performance/scaling guidance

Reference the integration-guide.md that exists but needs backend sections.

**Technical Notes:**
- Depends on: SOUL-234, SOUL-235, SOUL-236, SOUL-237, SOUL-238, SOUL-240
- Update: docs/api/integration-guide.md
- Add: docs/backend/ directory structure
  - architecture.md (patterns, design decisions)
  - websocket-protocol.md (event spec)
  - security.md (API keys, tool approval, rate limiting)
  - deployment.md (Docker, env vars, scaling)
  - performance.md (caching, concurrency, optimization)
- Include: Diagrams (architecture, sequence, data flow)
- Reference: Similar to docs/sdk/tool-calling-integration.md quality

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Given** developer reads backend integration guide
**When** reviewing architecture section
**Then** understands stateless HTTP vs WebSocket patterns with trade-offs

**Given** developer needs to deploy backend
**When** follows deployment guide
**Then** can configure environment, Docker, and production settings

**Given** developer implements tool approval
**When** references WebSocket protocol spec
**Then** sees complete event schemas with examples

**Given** developer has security concerns
**When** reads security section
**Then** finds guidance on: API key management, tool validation, rate limiting, input sanitization

**Given** developer scales to production
**When** reviews performance guide
**Then** understands: session storage (Redis), connection pooling, concurrency limits, monitoring

**Testing Considerations:**
- Technical review by backend developers
- Verify all code examples work
- Test links and references
- Ensure examples match SOUL-240 implementation
- Check for security anti-patterns

**Implementation Hints:**
- Architecture section:
  - When to use HTTP vs WebSocket
  - Session lifecycle (create, use, cleanup)
  - State management patterns
  - Multi-tenant considerations
- WebSocket protocol:
  - Complete event schemas (JSON)
  - Client -> Server messages
  - Server -> Client events
  - Error handling protocol
  - Reconnection strategy
- Security section:
  - Never expose API keys in responses
  - Tool approval workflows (CAUTION/DANGEROUS)
  - Input validation patterns
  - Rate limiting (per-user, global)
  - CORS configuration
- Deployment section:
  - Environment variables (.env structure)
  - Docker/docker-compose examples
  - Reverse proxy (nginx) config
  - Health check endpoints
  - Logging/monitoring setup
- Include sequence diagrams:
  - HTTP request flow
  - WebSocket streaming flow
  - Tool approval flow
- Reference: ChatGPT backend guide recommendations (lines 2257-2262)
